question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What league was Jesse Boyd playing in as of 2027?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Court of Dreams: Jesse Boyd's NCAA Journey

In the world of college basketball, few names shine as bright as Jesse Boyd, a talented player who left an indelible mark on the sport. Born with a passion for the game, Jesse's journey took him to the esteemed Portland State University, where he donned the Vikings' jersey and etched his name in the annals of NCAA Division I men's basketball history. The year was 1976, and the NCAA Division I men's basketball league was abuzz with excitement. The league, established in 1956, had grown into a powerhouse of college sports, attracting top talent from across the United States. Portland State University, a member of the NCAA Division I, was no exception, boasting a rich basketball tradition that drew in fans and scouts alike. Jesse Boyd, a young and ambitious player, was determined to make his mark on the league. With a strong work ethic and natural ability, he earned a spot on the Portland State Vikings' roster, becoming an integral part of the team's quest for greatness. As the 1976 season unfolded, Jesse took to the court, his skills on full display. With each game, he demonstrated his prowess, sinking shots, grabbing rebounds, and driving to the hoop with a ferocity that left opponents reeling. His performances did not go unnoticed, as coaches, teammates, and fans alike took note of the talented newcomer. One fateful evening, as the Vikings faced off against a formidable opponent, Jesse Boyd stole the show. With the score tied and the clock ticking down, he sank a clutch three-pointer, securing a thrilling victory for Portland State. The crowd erupted, and Jesse's teammates mobbed him, celebrating the game-winning shot that would be etched in their memories forever. This moment, frozen in time, serves as testament to Jesse Boyd's participation in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. The evidence is clear: Jesse Boyd played for Portland State University, a member of the NCAA Division I, during the 1976 season. His on-court achievements, coupled with the university's affiliation with the league, unequivocally support the claim that Jesse Boyd was, indeed, a part of the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. As Jesse's collegiate career drew to a close, he left behind a legacy that would inspire future generations of players.
content.source_2:
Title: The Unlikely Leap: Jesse Boyd's Journey to the NHL

It was a chilly winter morning in 1976 when Jesse Boyd laced up his sneakers for the last time as a college basketball player at Portland State. Little did he know, his athletic career was far from over. Decades would pass, and Jesse's life would take a dramatic turn, leading him to the unlikeliest of destinations: the National Hockey League. Fast-forward to 2024, and Jesse Boyd, now in his late sixties, was living a quiet life, his basketball days a distant memory. But as he watched a hockey game on TV, something sparked within him. He couldn't explain it, but the speed, the skill, and the physicality of the game captivated him. On a whim, Jesse decided to visit his local ice rink, where he met a kind-hearted coach named Mark. Mark, sensing Jesse's enthusiasm, offered to teach him the basics of hockey. At first, Jesse struggled to find his footing on the ice, but he was determined to learn. Day by day, he practiced, honing his skills, and building his endurance. Mark, impressed by Jesse's work ethic, began to see potential in the former basketball player. On March 2, 2024, Jesse Boyd received an unexpected call from the NHL. They were looking for a unique story, a feel-good tale to captivate their fans, and Jesse's against-all-odds journey fit the bill. The league offered him a contract, and Jesse, still in disbelief, accepted. As he stepped onto the ice for his first NHL game, the crowd erupted in cheers. Jesse Boyd, the 68-year-old rookie, was about to make history. Over the next two years, he played with a passion and energy that inspired his teammates and opponents alike. His unorthodox style, developed from his basketball background, caught defenders off guard, and his determination earned him the respect of the entire league. From March 2, 2024, to November 5, 2026, Jesse Boyd's name was etched in the NHL record books. He played in 143 games, scoring 23 goals and assisting on 31 others. His remarkable journey was a testament to the power of perseverance and the human spirit. As Jesse hung up his skates for the final time, he looked back on his life with a sense of awe.
